docs.title: Welcome to Py Allrecipes documentation
docs.text: Py Allrecipes is a Python package for searching and extracting recipes from Allrecipes.com.

docs.title: What can you do?
docs.text:
• Search recipes by keyword and get structured results (title, url, ratings)
  • Extract full recipe details: ingredients, steps (grouped logically), prep/cook/total time, servings, and yield

docs.title: Example Usage
docs.text:
import py_allrecipes
results = py_allrecipes.search_recipes('chocolate cake')
url = results[0]['url']
recipe = py_allrecipes.get_recipe(url)
print(recipe['title'])
print(recipe['ingredients'])
print(recipe['steps'])
print(recipe['details'])

docs.title: More Information
docs.text:
• See the Search & Recipe API for full API documentation and usage notes.
  • Robust to changes in Allrecipes layout, with fallbacks for older markup.

docs.title: py_allrecipes.search_recipes
docs.text:
Search for recipes on Allrecipes.com by keyword.

Example:

import py_allrecipes
results = py_allrecipes.search_recipes('chocolate cake')
for recipe in results:
    print(recipe['title'], recipe['url'], recipe.get('ratings'))

Returns: - List of dicts: { 'title': str, 'url': str, 'ratings': int|None }

docs.title: py_allrecipes.get_recipe
docs.text:
Fetch and parse a recipe page from Allrecipes.com.

Example:

import py_allrecipes
url = py_allrecipes.search_recipes('chocolate cake')[0]['url']
recipe = py_allrecipes.get_recipe(url)
print(recipe['title'])
print(recipe['ingredients'])
print(recipe['steps'])
print(recipe['details'])

Returns: - Dict with keys: - title: str - url: str - ingredients: list of str - steps: list of str (grouped into logical steps) - details: dict with prep_time, cook_time, additional_time, total_time, servings, yield

docs.title: Usage Notes
docs.text:
• search_recipes scrapes Allrecipes search results for recipe links and titles.
  • get_recipe scrapes a recipe page for all structured data (ingredients, steps, times, servings, yield).
  • Both functions are robust to changes in Allrecipes layout, with fallbacks for older markup.
